docs.snippet: ANITA ELLIS, the slim, dark-haired singer who began performing 40 years ago (she was in the film version of "Babes in Arms," with Judy Garland and Mickey Rooney,  when she was 18) and who has won an intensely devoted following although she has rar...
docs.lead_paragraph: ANITA ELLIS, the slim, dark-haired singer who began performing 40 years ago (she was in the film version of "Babes in Arms," with Judy Garland and Mickey Rooney, when she was 18) and who has won an intensely devoted following although she has rarely appeared in public, will give her first full-length concert Sunday evening at Alice Tully Hall at 8 P.M.
docs.abstract: Ellis, Anita: Singer to give 1st full-length concert of her career at Alice Tully Hall Feb 4; int (S)

headline.main: Anita Ellis Tells Why She's Singing; Anita Ellis Tells Why She's Singing

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31--In a tape purporting to record the final remarks of Shah of Iran to top military leaders just before he left the country Jan. 16, the Iranian Army was urged to "create a prolonged civil war" to give the Shah an opportunity to ...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31--In a tape purporting to record the final remarks of Shah of Iran to top military leaders just before he left the country Jan. 16, the Iranian Army was urged to "create a prolonged civil war" to give the Shah an opportunity to return and regain power.
docs.abstract: in tape purporting to record Shah's final remarks to top mil leaders before he left country Jan 16, Iranian Army is urged to 'create a prolonged civil war' to give Shah opportunity to return and regain power; Iranian Natl Front official Bahman Sholevar gives copy of tape to NY Times; CBS says 3 voice experts have verified that voice was Shah's; State Dept and CIA officials decline attempt to authenticate tape (M)

headline.main: Taped Talk, Purportedly by Shah, Urges Army to Foment Civil War; U.S. Declines Involvement 2 Expects Interviewed

byline.original: By A.O. SULZBERGER Jr. Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: "I have an antique, you know," announced Ed Koch, just a touch defensively, as if anyone ever could have thought otherwise. "I have an antique brass bed that my sister bought from a farmhouse 20 years ago." Then he added with satisfaction: "She bo...
docs.lead_paragraph: "I have an antique, you know," announced Ed Koch, just a touch defensively, as if anyone ever could have thought otherwise. "I have an antique brass bed that my sister bought from a farmhouse 20 years ago." Then he added with satisfaction: "She bought it for $9."
docs.abstract: comment; guests include Mario Buatta, Pam Sarnoff, Mr and Mrs Henry A Kissinger, Carlton B Lees and Lee Radziwell; illus (M)

docs.snippet: Every year the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences presents an Oscar for the best short subject. After this brief moment of recognition, the films usually slip into obscurity, having been viewed only by members of the academy and some movi...
docs.lead_paragraph: Every year the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences presents an Oscar for the best short subject. After this brief moment of recognition, the films usually slip into obscurity, having been viewed only by members of the academy and some movie buffs.
